intro: Brownea leucantha, commonly known as the white-barked brownea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its bark is smooth and often has a distinctive white or pale coloration, which contributes to its common name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
